content:
# I have now moved closer to the desired position for placing the stone furnaces.
# I will attempt to place the first stone furnace at the coordinates x=-14.5, y=26.5 again.

# Placing the first stone furnace.
first_furnace = place_entity(stone_furnace_prototype, position=Position(x=-14.5, y=26.5))
print(f"Placed first stone furnace at: {first_furnace.position}")

# Now, I will place the second stone furnace next to the first one.
second_furnace = place_entity_next_to(stone_furnace_prototype, reference_position=first_furnace.position, direction=Direction.RIGHT)
print(f"Placed second stone furnace at: {second_furnace.position}")

# After placing the furnaces, I can now insert coal into them to fuel the smelting process.
insert_item(Prototype.Coal, first_furnace, quantity=5)  # Insert fuel into the first furnace
insert_item(Prototype.Coal, second_furnace, quantity=5) # Insert fuel into the second furnace

# Now I will insert stone into the first furnace to begin the smelting process.
insert_item(Prototype.Stone, first_furnace, quantity=10)

# I can then smelt that stone into stone bricks while using the second furnace for the same purpose if required.
print("Stone has been inserted into the furnaces for smelting.")
